Issue #36 Citroën CX 2400 GTI 1981 J. P. Luc/P. Alessandrini

The 1981 Dakar departed from Trocadéro in Paris on January 1 and took competitors through France, Algeria, Mali, Upper Volta, Ivory Coast, and finishing in Dakar, Senegal on January 20 for a total of 2,086 miles.

Citroën entered 5 Citroën CX 2400 GTIs in the 1981 Dakar with one those driven by the team of Jean-Paul Luc and Philippe Alessandrini. Their CX was the only survivor of the 5 factory-entered CXs. With 1 stage win Luc & Alessandrini finished in 16th place overall and took 1st place in the 3-1 category. The 3-1 category was for significantly modified gasoline-powered 2-wheel drive production cars.
